content:
## EXISTING STRUCTURES

### Iron Plate Production Facility at Position (-13.0, -48.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (-15.0, -50.0) with a drop position at (-14.5, -48.5)
- Stone Furnace at position (-13.0, -48.0)
- Iron Chest at position (-14.5, -48.5) for storing iron ore
- Burner Inserter at position (-11.5, -49.5) to transfer items to the furnace
- Wooden Chest at position (-12.5, -49.5) for temporary storage
- Additional Stone Furnaces at positions (-11.0, -48.0) and (-9.0, -48.0) for smelting
- Iron Chests at positions (-13.5, -49.5) and (-14.5, -47.5) for storing iron plates

### Coal Mining and Storage Facility at Position (41.0, -82.0)
Consists of the following entities:
- Burner Mining Drill at position (41.0, -82.0) with a drop position at (41.5, -80.5)
- Stone Furnace at position (43.0, -82.0)
- Iron Chests at positions (41.5, -80.5), (42.5, -80.5), and (44.5, -80.5) for storing coal and iron plates
- Burner Inserters at positions (43.5, -80.5) for transferring items between chests and furnaces

## ERROR TIPS

### Errors when managing inventory
- Ensure that the items you intend to insert into chests or furnaces are available in your inventory. Check inventory levels before attempting to deposit items.

### Errors when supplying materials to furnaces
- Make sure there is sufficient iron ore in your inventory before attempting to supply it to furnaces. Regularly monitor and replenish your iron ore stock to avoid supply interruptions.

### Errors when using inserters
- Ensure that the destination for the inserter is not blocked. Clear any obstructions from the inserter's drop position to maintain smooth operation.

### Errors when mining
- Regularly check and empty chests at mining drill drop positions to prevent mining operations from halting due to full chests.
